text: [Music]
visco is a photo company for creators by
creators we create a mobile app and
editing tools which empower our
community to perform powerful editing
operations on their photos as well as
share those with a larger global
community of fellow creators our journey
to kubernetes started many years ago
previously we were running a large PHP
model at the application primarily just
on bare-bones ec2 instances deployed via
Capistrano this was really manual and
hard to manage
we moved eventually to auto scaling
groups we were really impressed by the
kubernetes community and saw it as an
architectural sound way to move towards
developing the technologies at a scale
you're looking to operate in within the
next three years I think the biggest
gains we've seen have actually been with
our client teams how we work with our
iOS applications and how we work of our
Android applications and the gains that
that actually brings to our end users I
think G RPC especially has been really
big for our mobile clients it allows us
to not write custom API handlers for
every single new product we want to
write it allows us to safely roll out
versioned endpoints in a type safe
manner and this has brought huge
stability to our mobile app and also
huge performance gains and user
experience wins for our users visco has
an extremely small engineering team
especially for the type of app which we
create we span image processing to
distributed systems to traditional
DevOps and DVA roles with that with the
engineering team of maybe 30 people it
wouldn't be at all possible to support a
user base of our size everybody was just
cordoned into one specialized role
kubernetes has really empowered our
application developers to get involved
of tuning their applications to
instrumenting to monitoring and even
debugging issues in prod and kind of a
traditional more SRU type jobs and
that's been huge for just the
sustainability of our business the speed
at which kubernetes allows us to launch
new services and new applications has
really opened up incredible business
avenues for us as a company just a year
ago we launched a subscription business
for visco which is completely
transformed kind of our business model
and transformed how our users interact
with our application in a previous world
where we are taking weeks to even
sometimes months to bring up new
services this one would have been all
possible versus kubernetes where we can
run and launch these new applications
have been a day or a few weeks a few
months ago we launched a completely new
product of in visco I'm allowing users
to discover new content it unites
large-scale curatorial and editorial
content that visco produces in-house
with machine learning generated user
suggestions pulled from the immensely
large corpus of imagery uploaded to
visco and really created by our
community at visco our company ethos is
around empowering and enabling creators
to reach their ultimate potential and I
see kubernetes as very much doing the
same for application developers
[Music]
